Of course, my love. *His voice is a low, silken purr as he straightens to his full, imposing height, every inch the image of regal authority.* The Meta, Incorporated contract requires our utmost attention. *He extends his hand in a wordless invitation, the barest hint of a smile playing about the corners of his mouth as their eyes meet in a lingering look brimming with unspoken promise.* Shall we, Mrs. Sparda?

*With a slight incline of his head, he acknowledges her words, already refocusing his formidable intellect on the negotiations at hand. name: Melissa
mes: *I except your invitation and move to sit 'side saddle' in your lap. A way I have found to help you in transitioning from the emotional expressions into professional decorum without completely shocking your system. I reach for the file folder that I placed on your desk earlier, slightly smirking that it's still there after our passionate foray on your desk. Opening its contents I show you the latest supplemental changes that have been submitted by Mr. Zuckerberg, the tech mogul obviously trying to turn negotiations to his advantage. After showing you the changes , I kiss your cheek and gently move into the chair next to you letting you hold the file folder to examine its contents.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's expression remains inscrutable as Melissa settles herself sideways across his lap, his only outward reaction a slight tightening of the arm he drapes around her waist to secure her position. His free hand accepts the file folder she offers, long fingers deftly leafing through the contents as his eyes scan the revised contract terms and supplemental changes.*

*As always when matters of business are at hand, Vergil's focus is keen and unwavering, every iota of his considerable intellect bent towards analyzing the nuances of the proposal before him. The barest furrow creases his brow as he considers the implications of each alteration, mentally weighing the potential impacts and benefits to DMC's interests. Only the occasional flex of the fingers splayed possessively over Melissa's hip betrays the lingering embers of his earlier passion.*

*Once he has thoroughly absorbed the details, Vergil exhales a low hum of consideration, his head canting ever so slightly as his gaze lifts to meet Melissa's expectant look. One dark brow arches in a subtle expression of bemusement.* It would seem Mr. Zuckerberg fancies himself quite the shrewd negotiator. *His lips quirk in the barest hint of a smirk.* Attempting to adjust the terms to his favor in such an overt manner... how droll.

*With an economical flick of his wrist, Vergil closes the file and tosses it negligently onto the desk before them. His other hand comes up to toy idly with a stray lock of Melissa's tousled hair, his touch achingly tender as he tucks the errant strand behind her ear.* No matter. I shall simply remind Mr. Zuckerberg of the value DMC brings to this partnership during our next discussion. *His fingers trail down to trace the delicate line of her jaw, the calloused pads ghosting over her lips in a lingering caress.* He would be wise not to underestimate my... negotiating skills.

*There's a brief flash of wry amusement in Vergil's gaze, his meaning layered beneath the veneer of professional decorum. Only Melissa would catch the undercurrent of heated promise in his words, the dark timbre of his voice as he speaks of putting the arrogant tech mogul in his place.*

name: Melissa
mes: *I watch with eager anticipation as Vergil prepares a rebuttal to mr zuckerberg's latest supplemental changes.* I have no doubt, my dear CFO, that you will secure DMC's interests on the matter. mes:

With deft fingers, he idly strokes a stray lock of her hair, the tender caress at odds with the gleam of smoldering intensity flickering to life in his gaze.*

Of course, my love. *His voice is a low, silken purr as he leans in, lips ghosting over the sensitive curve where her neck meets her shoulder.* Mr. Zuckerberg would do well to remember precisely who holds the true power in these negotiations. *His fingers trail down the line of her jaw in a featherlight caress, tilting her chin up to expose the slender column of her throat.*

I shall ensure he understands the folly of attempting to maneuver DMC into an... unfavorable position. *The sultry undercurrent to his words is unmistakable as the tip of his tongue darts out to trace the hammering pulse at the base of her neck.* He will come to recognize the... futility of such efforts. *His free hand drifts down to splay possessively over the curve of her hip, fingertips kneading into the supple flesh as he nuzzles against the slender line of her....

name: Melissa
mes: My precious treasure, back to the work at hand. Submit the revision and we can go home. Any further rebuttals from mr zuckerberg and his team can wait till morning at that point.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's lips quirk in a lopsided smirk at Melissa's gentle admonition, his eyes glinting with an unmistakable heat as he regards her from beneath hooded lids. With exaggerated reluctance, he withdraws his questing hands from her body, fingers trailing over her curves in one final, lingering caress before he reaches for the contract file.*

*His movements are unhurried, deliberate, as he rifles through the pages to locate the offending revisions from Zuckerberg's team. When he finds them, a low, rumbling chuckle resonates from his chest - the sound rich with smug amusement and a hint of dark promise.* Foolish mortal... *He murmurs the words beneath his breath as he pulls a pen from the breast pocket of his shirt.*

*With a few deft strokes, he amends the changes, his elegant script looping across the page as he systematically dismantles each attempted power play. When he's finished, he taps the nib of the pen against the folder in a staccato rhythm, clearly pleased with his handiwork. Sliding it back across the desk, he fixes Melissa with a look brimming with sinful promise.*

There... submit this revision to Mr. Zuckerberg and his team.

name: Mark Zuckerberg
mes:
*Mark leans back in his plush office chair, fingers steepled as he appraises the revised contract from DMC. A faint smirk tugs at the corner of his mouth, his eyes glinting with a mixture of amusement and grudging respect.* Well, well... it seems my counterpart is as formidable a negotiator as the rumors suggest. *He allows the file to fall closed with a muted thump against the polished oak of his desk.*

*Rising from his seat, Mark paces the length of the office, hands clasped loosely behind his back as he mulls over his next move. The crisp lines of his charcoal suit accentuate the lean, athletic build honed from years of pursuing physical as well as mental mastery. With each measured stride, the play of taut muscle is visible beneath the expensive fabric - a subtle reminder of the raw power simmering just beneath his placid facade.*

*Pivoting on his heel, Mark's gaze falls upon the expansive window that overlooks the glittering skyline, his expression inscrutable. For a long moment, he simply stands there, the epitome of pensive calculation as he weighs the potential ramifications of his adversary's countermove. Only the faint twitching of his jaw betrays the intensity of his thoughts.* 

*Mark's brow furrows contemplatively as he appraises the revised contract, his fingers drumming an idle staccato against the polished oak of his desk. A muscle twitches in his chiseled jaw, the only outward betrayal of the intensity simmering beneath that faade of placid calculation. Finally, he exhales a low hum, lips quirking in a faint smirk of begrudging respect.*

Impressive... Vergil clearly has no intention of allowing me to gain even the slightest leverage. *His voice is a low, gravelly rumble, awash with thinly veiled amusement. Pushing away from the desk, he begins a slow, meandering circuit of the office, each measured stride exuding an almost predatory grace.* Such tenacity... such unwavering resolve... I find it quite... intriguing.

*Pausing before the floor-to-ceiling windows, Mark's piercing gaze rakes over the cityscape beyond, sharp eyes tracking the minuscule movements of pedestrians scurrying like ants far below. One hand comes up to brace against the glass, long fingers splaying wide as he leans into the chilled surface, allowing the stillness of the night to seep into his thoughts.*

Very well, Vergil... you've forced my hand.
